item.title: Using Firebase for Storage
item.description: Using Firebase for Storage A quick and easy way to set up your own annotation store without managing your own server is through Firebase, a web application development platform by Google. Firebase includes a cloud-based document database with a JavaScript SDK for storing, updating and deleting JSON records. All you need to do is wire up the Firebase storage SDK operations with the corresponding events from Annotorious. item.title: Contributing UI Translations
item.description: We want to make Annotorious available in as many languages as possible. If you want to help: providing a translation is easy - and because Annotorious doesn’t have many labeled user interface elements, it’s also not a lot of work. How to add a new translation The user interface labels are part of the recogito-client-core package, located here. In this folder you will find messages files, one for each available translation.
